definition[0]: the round part of a clock, watch, machine etc that has numbers that show you the time or a measurement
example[0]: The lighted dial of her watch said 1.20.
example[1]: She looked at the dial to check her speed.
definition[1]: the part of a piece of equipment such as a radio or thermostat that you turn around to do something, such as find a different station or change the temperature
example[2]: The dial on the heater was set to ‘HOT’.
definition[2]: the wheel on an older telephone with numbered holes for your fingers that you move around in order to make a call
definition[3]: to press the buttons or turn the dial on a telephone in order to make a telephone call
example[3]: I think I dialed the wrong number.
definition[4]: a type of soap used for washing the body and face, sold in the US
